1.t: Alif. Lam. Ra. A Book has been revealed to you, (Muhammad), so that, by the permission of their Lord, you would be able to lead people from darkness into light along the path of the Majestic, Praised One.
1.tr: Alif-Laaam-Raa; Kitaabun anzalnaahu ilaika litukhrijan naasa minaz zulumaati ilan noori bi-izni Rabbihim ilaa siraatil 'Azeezil Hameed

2.t: To God belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Woe to the disbelievers; they will face the most severe punishment!
2.tr: Allaahil lazee lahoo maa fis samaawaati Wa-maa fill ard; Wa-wailul lilkaafireena min 'azaabin shadeed

3.t: It is they who have given preference to the worldly life over the life to come. They create obstacles in the way that leads to God and try to make it seem crooked. They are in manifest error.
3.tr: Allazeena yastahibboo-nal hayaatad dunyaa 'alal aakhirati Wa-yasuddoona 'ansabeelil laahi Wa-yabghoonahaa 'iwajaa; ulaaa 'ika fee dalaalin ba'eed

4.t: All the Messengers that We sent spoke the language of their people so that they could explain (their message to them). God guides or causes to go astray whomever He wants. He is Majestic and All-wise.
4.tr: Wa-maaa arsalnaa mir Rasoolin illaa bilisaani qawmihee liyubaiyina lahum fa-yudillul laahu mai yashaaa'u Wa-yahdee mai yashaaa'; Wa-Huwal 'Azeezul Hakeem

5.t: We sent Moses and gave him miracles in order to lead his people from darkness into light and to remind them of the days of God. In this there is evidence (of the truth) for those who exercise patience and give thanks.
5.tr: Wa-laqad arsalnaa Moosaa bi-Aayaatinaa an akhrij qawmaka minaz zulumaati ilan noori Wa-zak-kirhum bi-ayyaamil laah; inna fee zaalika la-aayaatil likulli sabbaarin shakoor

6.t: Moses told his people, "Remember the favors that God granted you when He saved you from the people of the Pharaoh who had punished you in the worst manner by murdering your sons and keeping your women alive. It was a great trial for you from your Lord.
6.tr: Wa-iz qaala Moosaa liqawmihiz kuroo ni'matal laahi 'alaikum iz anjaakum min Aali Fir'awna yasoomoo-nakum sooo'al 'azaabi Wa-yuzabbihoona abnaaa'akum Wa-yastahyoona nisaaa'akum; Wa-fee zaalikum balaaa'un mir Rabbikum 'azeem

7.t: "Remember when your Lord said to you, 'If you give thanks, I shall give you greater (favors), but if you deny the Truth, know that My retribution is severe ".
7.tr: Wa-iz ta-azzana Rabbukum la'in shakartum la-azeedannakum Wa-la'in kafartum inna 'azaabee lashadeed

8.t: Moses told his people, "If you and everyone on the earth turn to disbelief, know that God is Self-sufficient and Praiseworthy."
8.tr: Wa-qaala Moosaaa in takfurooo antum Wa-man fil ardi jamee'an fa-innal laaha la-Ghaniyyun Hameed

9.t: Have you (believers) ever heard the news about those who lived before you, like the people of Noah, Ad, Thamud, and those who lived after them? No one knows about them except God. Messengers were sent to them with miracles, but they put their hands to their mouths and said, "We do not believe in whatever you preach and we are also doubtful and uncertain about that to which you invite us."
9.tr: Alam ya'tikum naba'ul lazeena min qablikum qawmi Noohinw Wa-'Aadinw Wa-Samood, wallazeena mim ba'dihim; laa ya'lamuhum illallaah; jaaa'at hum Rusuluhum bilbaiyinaati faraddooo aydiyahum feee afwaahihim Wa-qaalooo innaa kafarnaa bimaaa ursiltum bihee Wa-innaa lafee shakkim mimmaa tad'oonanaaa ilaihi mureeb

10.t: The Messengers asked them, "Could there be any doubt about the existence of God who has created the heavens and the earth? He calls you to Himself to forgive your sins. He gives you respite only until the appointed time." They said, "You are mere mortals like us. What you want is to prevent us from worshipping that which our fathers worshipped. Show us clear proof (if what you say is true)."
10.tr: Qaalat Rusuluhum afil laahi shakkun faatiris samaawaati wal-ardi yad'ookum liyaghfira lakum min zunoobikum Wa-yu'akhirakum ilaaa ajalin musammaa; qaaloo in antum illaa basharum mislunaa tureedoona an tasuddoonaa 'ammaa kaana ya'budu aabaaa'unaa fa'toonaa bi-sultaanin mubeen

11.t: The Messengers replied, "We are certainly mere mortals like you, but God bestows His favors on whichever of His servants He wants. We can not bring you authority without the permission of God. The faithful should trust in God alone.
11.tr: Qaalat lahum Rusuluhum in nahnu illaa basharum mislukum Wa-laakinnal laaha yamunnu 'alaa maien yashaaa'u min 'ibaadihee Wa-maa kaana lanaaa an na'tiyakum bisul-taanin illaa bi-iznil laah; Wa-'alal laahi falyatawakkalil mu'minoon

12.t: Why should we not trust in God when He has shown us the right way? We shall exercise patience against the troubles with which you afflict us. Whoever needs a trustee should trust in God."
12.tr: Wa-maa lanaa allaa natawakkala 'alal laahi Wa-qad hadaanaa subulanaa; Wa-lanasbiranna 'alaa maaa aazaitumoonaa; Wa-'alal laahi falyatawakkalil mutawakkiloon

13.t: The disbelievers told the Messengers, "We shall expel you from our land unless you revert to our religion." Their Lord then sent them (the messengers) a revelation, "We have decided to destroy the unjust
13.tr: Wa-qaalal lazeena kafaroo li-Rusulihim lanukhrijanna-kum min aardinaaa aw la-ta'oodunna fee millatinaa fa-awhaaa ilaihim Rabbuhum lanuhlikannaz zaalimeen

14.t: and settle you in the land thereafter. This is for those who are afraid of Me and of My warning."
14.tr: Wa-lanuskinan-nakumul arda min ba'dihim; zaalika liman khaafa maqaamee Wa-khaafa wa'eed

15.t: They prayed for victory and the haughty transgressors were defeated.

16.t: Thereafter they will face hell fire wherein they will drink boiling water.
16.tr: Minw waraaa'ihee jahannamu Wa-yusqaa min maaa'in sadeed

17.t: As they sip the unpleasant water, death will approach them from all sides, but they will never die. In addition to this, they will experience the most intense torment.
17.tr: Yatajarra'uhoo Wa-laa yakaadu yuseeghuhoo Wa-ya'teehil mawtu min kulli makaaninw Wa-maa huwa bimaiyitinw Wa-minw waraaa'ihee 'azaabun ghaleez

18.t: The deeds of those who deny the existence of their Lord are like ashes blown about by a strong wind on a stormy day. They will achieve nothing from their deeds. (What they have done) is a manifest error.
18.tr: Masalul lazeena kafaroo bi-Rabbihim; a'maaluhum karamaadinish taddat bihir reehu fee yawmin 'aasifin; laa yaqdiroona mimmaa kasaboo 'alaa shai'; zaalika huwad dalaalul ba'eed

19.t: Do you not realize that God has created the heavens and the earth for a genuine purpose
19.tr: Alam tara annal laaha khalaqas samaawaati wal-arda bilhaqq; iny yasha yuzhibkum Wa-ya'ti bikhalqin jadeed

20.t: and that it is not at all difficult for God to replace you with another creature if He so wills?

21.t: (On the Day of Judgment) everyone will appear before God and those who have been suppressed will say to their oppressors, "We were your followers, can you do anything to rescue us from the torment of God?" They will reply, "Had God guided us, we would also have guided you. It makes no difference whether we cry for help or exercise patience; there is no escape for us."
21.tr: Wa-barazoo lillaahi jamee'an faqaalad du'afaaa'u lil-lazeenas takbarooo innaa kunnaa lakum taba'an fahal antum mughnoona 'annaa min 'azaabil laahi min shai'; qaaloo law hadaanal laahu la-hadaynaakum sawaaa'un 'alainaaa ajazi'naa am sabarnaa maa lanaa min mahees

22.t: When the decree of God is issued, satan will say, "God's promise to you was true, but I, too, made a promise to you and disregarded it. I had no authority over you. I just called you and you answered. Do not blame me but blame yourselves. I cannot help you and you cannot help me. I did not agree with your belief that I was equal to God." The unjust will face a painful punishment.
22.tr: Wa-qaalash Shaitaanu lammaa qudiyal amru innal laaha wa'adakum wa'dal haqqi Wa-wa'attukum fa-akhlaftukum Wa-maa kaana liya 'alaikum min sultaanin illaaa an da'awtukum fastajabtum lee falaa taloomoonee Wa-loomooo anfusakum maaa ana bimusrikhikum Wa-maaa antum bimusrikhiyya innee kafartu bimaaa ashraktumooni min qabl; innaz zaalimeena lahum azaabun aleem

23.t: The righteously striving believers will be admitted to the gardens wherein streams flow and they will live therein forever, by the permission of their Lord. Their greeting to each other will be, "Peace be with you."
23.tr: Wa-udkhilal lazeena aamanoo Wa-'amilus saalihaati Jannaatin tajree min tahtihal anhaaru khaalideena feehaa bi-izni Rabbihim tahiyyatuhum feeha salaam

24.t: Consider (Muhammad) how God (in a parable) compares the blessed Word to that of a blessed tree which has firm roots and branches rising up into the sky
24.tr: Alam tara kaifa darabal laahu masalan kalimatan taiyibatan kashajaratin taiyibatin asluhaa saabitunw Wa-far'uhaa fis samaaa'

25.t: and yields fruits in every season, by the permission of its Lord? God sets forth parables for people so that they may take heed.
25.tr: Tu'teee ukulahaa kulla heenim bi-izni Rabbihaa; Wa-yadribul laahul amsaala linnaasi la'allahum yatazak-karoon

26.t: An evil word is compared to an evil tree with no firm roots in the land and thus has no stability.
26.tr: Wa-masalu kalimatin khabeesatin kashajaratin khabee-satinij tussat min fawqil ardi maa lahaa min qaraar

27.t: God strengthens the faith of the believers by the true Words in this world and in the life to come. He causes the unjust to go astray and does whatever He pleases.
27.tr: Yusabbitul laahul lazeena aamanoo bilqawlis saabiti fil hayaatid dunyaa Wa-fil Aakhirati Wa-yudillul laahuz zaalimeen; Wa-yaf'alul laahu maa yashaaa'

28.t: Have you not seen those who changed the Word of God through disbelief and led their people to destruction?
28.tr: Alam tara ilal lazeena baddaloo ni'matal laahi kufranw Wa-ahalloo qawmahum daaral bawaar

29.t: They will suffer in Hell. What a terrible place to stay!

30.t: To lead people astray, they claimed their idols were equal to God. (Muhammad), tell them, "Enjoy yourselves and know that the only place for you to go will be hell fire."
30.tr: Wa-ja'aloo lillaahi andaadal liyudilloo 'an sabeelih; qul tamatta'oo fa-innaa maseerakum ilan Naar

31.t: Tell My believing servants to be steadfast in prayer and to spend for the cause of their Lord, both in private and in public, out of what We have given them. Let them do this before the coming of the day when there will be no merchandising or friendship.
31.tr: Qul li'ibaadiyal lazeena aamanoo yuqeemus Salaata Wa-yunfiqoo mimmaa razaqnaahum sirranw Wa-'alaaniyatam min qabli any yaatiya Yawmul laa bai'un feehi Wa-laa khilaal

32.t: God is the One who created the heavens and the earth, sent down water from the sky by which He produced fruits for your sustenance, enabled you to use boats to sail on the sea, and placed the rivers at your disposal, all by His command.
32.tr: Allaahul lazee khalaqas samaawaati wal-arda Wa-anzala minas samaaa'i maaa'an faakhraja bihee minas samaraati rizqal lakum Wa-sakhkhara lakumul fulka litajriya fil bahri bi-amrihee Wa-sakhkhara lakumul anhaar

33.t: He made the sun and moon, each following its course, and the day and the night all subservient to you.
33.tr: Wa-sakhkhara lakumush shamsa walqamara daaa'ibaini Wa-sakhkhara lakumul laila wannahaar

34.t: He has given you everything that you asked Him for. Had you wanted to count the bounties of God, you would not have been able to do it. The human being is unjust and disbelieving.
34.tr: Wa-aataakum min kulli maa sa-altumooh; Wa-in ta'uddoo ni'matal laahi laa tuhsoohaa; innal insaana lazaloo-mun kaffaar

35.t: (Muhammad), consider when Abraham prayed, "Lord, make this (Mecca) a peaceful territory and save me and my offspring from worshipping idols.
35.tr: Wa-iz qaala Ibraaheemu Rabbij 'al haazal balada aaminanw wajnubnee Wa-baniyya an na'budal asnaam

36.t: Lord, the idols have misled many people. Whoever follows me is my friend. As for those who disobey, You are certainly All-forgiving and All-merciful.
36.tr: Rabbi innahunna adlalna kaseeram minan naasi faman tabi'anee fa-innahoo minnee Wa-man 'asaanee fa-innaka Ghafoorur Raheem

37.t: "Lord, I have settled some of my offspring in a barren valley near your Sacred House so that they could be steadfast in prayer. Lord, fill the hearts of the people with love for them and produce fruits for their sustenance so that they may give thanks.
37.tr: Rabbanaaa inneee askantu min zurriyyatee biwaadin ghairi zee zar'in 'inda Baitikal Muharrami Rabbanaa liyuqeemus Salaata faj'al af'idatam minan naasi tahweee ilaihim warzuqhum minas samaraati la'allahum yashkuroon

38.t: Lord, You know all that we conceal or reveal. Nothing in the heavens or the earth is hidden from God.
38.tr: Rabbanaaa innaka ta'lamu maa nukhfee Wa-maa nu'lin; Wa-maa yakhfaa 'alal laahi min shai'in fil ardi Wa-laa fis samaaa'

39.t: It is only God who deserves all praise. I praise Him for His giving me my sons Ishmael and Isaac during my old age. My Lord, certainly, hears all prayers.
39.tr: Alhamdu lillaahil lazee wahaba lee 'alal kibari Ismaa'eela Wa-Ishaaq; inna Rabbee lasamee'ud du'aaa

40.t: Lord, make me and my offspring steadfast in prayer and accept our worship.
40.tr: Rabbij 'alnee muqeemas Salaati Wa-min zurriyyatee Rabbanaa Wa-taqabbal du'aaa'

41.t: Lord, on the Day of Judgment, forgive me and my parents and all the believers."
41.tr: Rabbanagh fir lee Wa-liwaalidaiya Wa-lilmu'mineena Yawma yaqoomul hisaab

42.t: (Muhammad), do not think that God is unaware of what the unjust people do. He only gives them a respite until the day when the eyes will stare fixedly,
42.tr: Wa-laa tahsabannal laaha ghaafilan 'ammaa ya'maluz zaalimoon; innamaa yu'akh-khiruhum li-Yawmin tashkhasu feehil absaar

43.t: when people will hurry in fright, their heads raised, their eyes unable to look around, and their hearts stunned due to the confusion (which will prevail on that Day).
43.tr: Muhti'eena muqni'ee ru'oosihim laa yartaddu ilaihim tarfuhum Wa-af'idatuhum hawaaa'

44.t: (Muhammad), warn the people of the day when torment will approach them and the unjust will say, "Lord, give us respite for a little time so that we may answer your call and follow the Messengers." (The answer to their prayer will be), "Did you not swear before that you would never perish?
44.tr: Wa-anzirin naasa Yawma yaateehimul 'azaabu fa-yaqoolul lazeena zalamoo Rabbanaaa akhkhirnaaa ilaaa ajalin qareebin nujib da'wataka Wa-nattabi-'ir Rusul; awalam takoonooo aqsamtum min qablu maa lakum min zawaal

45.t: You lived in the dwellings of those who wronged themselves, even though it was made clear to you how We dealt with them. We also showed you examples."
45.tr: Wa-sakantum fee masaakinil lazeena zalamooo anfusahum Wa-tabaiyana lakum kaifa fa'alnaa bihim Wa-darabnaa lakumul amsaal

46.t: They devised evil plans which were so sinful that even the mountains could not endure them. All these were known to God.
46.tr: Wa-qad makaroo makrahum Wa-'indal laahi makruhum Wa-in kaana makruhum litazoola minhul jibaal

47.t: You must not even think that God will disregard His promise to His messengers. God is Majestic and Revengeful.
47.tr: Falaa tahsabannal laaha mukhlifa wa'dihee Rusulah; innal laaha 'azeezun zun tiqaam

48.t: On the day when the earth and the heavens will be replaced by another earth and heavens and everyone will be brought before the One Almighty God,
48.tr: Yawma tubaddalul ardu ghairal ardi wassamaawaatu Wa-barazoo lillaahil Waahidil Qahhaar

49.t: you will see the guilty ones bound in chains,
49.tr: Wa-taral mujrimeena Yawma'izim muqarraneena filas faad

50.t: with garments of pitch and faces covered by fire.
50.tr: Saraabeeluhum min qatiraaninw Wa-taghshaa wujoohahumun Naar

51.t: This is how God will recompense each soul for its deeds. God's reckoning is swift.
51.tr: Liyajziyal laahu kulla nafsim maa kasabat; innal laaha saree'ul hisaab

52.t: This is an admonition for the people that they will be warned and know that He is the only God, and so that the people of understanding may take heed.
52.tr: Haaza balaaghul linnaasi Wa-liyunzaroo bihee Wa-liya'lamooo annamaa Huwa Illaahunw Waahidunw Wa-liyaz-zakkara ulul albaab
